title: [Large-scale] Ethics in Instructional Design and Technology Application: Reflective Practice and Critical Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design principles and practical experience in scientific fields
context.additional_context: Case-based learning for instructional designers/educators in science industries, focusing on ethical dilemmas encountered in real-world tasks

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three ethical issues that may arise during the science education design process.
Learners can develop self-assessment tools for ethical decision-making in instructional design by applying reflective practice.
Learners can create ethical alternative design proposals using critical design techniques and incorporate peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
